content:
Nice clash, but the output varying from two lines to one line depending on whether there are any unknowns is a bit awkward. The Statement under "Output" clearly says that there should be two lines of output. It seems more natural to just put an empty line if there are no variables, but instead your solution forces answers to reduce to a single line if there is nothing to put on the second line (i.e. it penalizes a newline after the 1st line of output if nothing follows the newline).

Also, it would be good to put 0 < [[n]] < 5 in the "Constraints" section, so people know that there will never be 0 equations.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Original and challenging for code size, with a clear concept.

Good puzzle, and of a type that I haven't seen here before.
In "Constraints", please state that each unknown is a single lower-case [a-z] character.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting for a short test.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great !! Maybe it's a beat difficult depending on the method used.

Input section
* Please change "first lign" to "Line 1: ".

* Please add description for <<Next [[n]] lines:>>.

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for clashes:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

Please revise the output requirements so that there are more than 2 possible answers in total (not just true/false).

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.

Thank you for making the changes.

There is still a binary output issue. There should be more than 2 possible answers in total. I refer to the number of possible answers, not the wording of the answers, so changing to Cramer/Not Cramer does not solve the issue.

Thank you for making the changes.

Output section
* Please change "unknows" to "unknowns".

Cases
* Please change "unknows" to "unknowns" in the case titles (2 times).

Thanks.
